result.execSummary:
The defendant Deven A Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs due during term of probation.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
Upon successful completion of probation and no new violations rising to the level of probable cause.

-Alcohol/drug assessment and any counseling and treatment deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-No drug paraphenalia.
-Random tests.
-Defendant must complete high school diploma requirements.
-Defendant must maintain employment of 24 hours per week or attend post high school education full time.
-Submit DNA sample/pay surcharge.
-Pay supervision fees.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deven A Patterson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Clerk is informed from DOC that defendant was in  absconder status and in custody from 6/30/2016 to 7/10/2016, his discharge date. On Court's direction, expungement removed.
Defendant Deven A Patterson in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court renders sentence.
Atty Kees submits sentencing documents - scanned & forwarded to B1 for sentencing on 7/10
Sentencing hearing on July 10, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Deven A Patterson in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint and penalties thereof. Defendant enters guilty plea.   Court examines defendant, finds him guilty. State recommends probation w/90 days jail and conditions. Defense free to argue at sentencing. Counsel request adjourned sentencing date. Bail to continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Further proceedings on June 17, 2014 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Deven A Patterson in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kees needs additional time to contact the District Attorney's office for pretrial. Bail to continue.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Deven A Patterson
Current: 8075 N 44th Street, Brown Deer, WI 53223 United States  (Effective: 03-19-2014)
Prior: 2463 N Bartlett Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53211
Further proceedings on May 5, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Deven A Patterson in court with attorney Anna M. Kees.  Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amend complaint received by defendant.  Defense waives reading of the information and/or complaint.  Court questions defendant regarding waiver and binds matter over.  Information filed by the State.  Defendant waives reading of the information and enters a plea of not guilty.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant's - scanned and forwarded to Br. 1.

State by DA Adam Gerol.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Dejunco.  Counsel advises defendant not sure if retaining private counsel.  Court advises defendant of penalties.  Court examines defendant on right to counsel.  State requesting $1000 signature bond w/conditions.  Court orders $1000 signature bond w/conditions:  no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed; absolute sobriety; not to possess any syringes; no contact with C.M.L.   Court finds good cause to extend timelimits for holding of the preliminary hearing.  Court orders matter adj to 3/18 at 8:45 am for status of prelim hrg.
